cause_of_action: Dispute over unpaid repairs and materials supplied to the ship 'Jensen Star'.
relevant_statute: s. 43(3) of the Federal Court Act
procedure_followed: Trial in Federal Court involving claims in personam and in rem, followed by judgment on legal issues including beneficial ownership and payment attribution.
decision_reasoning: Jensen Shipping's control under the charter creates sufficient ownership interest, and they are estopped from denying ownership due to misleading conduct.
result_of_case: Plaintiff awarded $237,243.68 plus interest and costs; in rem claim upheld.

cause_of_action: denied access citing exemptions under the Access to Information Act
procedure_followed: Judicial review initiated after complaints to the Information Commissioner. Court reviewed documents and legal arguments
decision_reasoning: Main Record: The Senior Public Rights Administrator incorrectly applied Section 19(2). Secret Record: Most pages were exempt under Sections 19 and 23 due to personal information or solicitor-client privilege
result_of_case: Court ordered reevaluation of Main Record and upheld nondisclosure of most Secret Record pages while dismissing claims on irrelevant pages.
conclusion_outcome: Main Record must be redetermined by a different official. Secret Record's nondisclosure upheld for privileged/personal information pages
